```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(viridis)
library(p8105.datasets)
library(plotly)
```

```{r}
set.seed(1)

data(nyc_airbnb)
nyc_airbnb = 
  nyc_airbnb %>% 
  mutate(rating = review_scores_location / 2) %>%
  select(boro = neighbourhood_group, neighbourhood, rating, price, room_type,
         latitude, longitude) %>%
  filter(!is.na(rating), 
         boro == "Manhattan",
         room_type == "Entire home/apt",
         price %in% 100:500)  %>% 
  sample_n(5000)
```

He often prefers to use plotly itself, rather than ggplot converted to plotly using ggplotly - when using plots for external use
